resources.string: Set default resource selection preferences. This will affect both online playback and caching
The selection made during playback for each anime will override these settings
Unselected resolutions will still be displayed, but won\'t be automatically selected

Supports regular expressions, separated by commas. Higher priority is given to expressions listed first

Example: 桜都, 喵萌, 北宇治
Will prioritize 桜都 subtitle group resources, then 喵萌, and so on
Fine-tune the data source auto-selection algorithm. Generally, you don\'t need to modify these settings
Online sources load faster but may have lower resolution, BT sources are the opposite
Sort by data source, and select immediately when higher-ranked sources complete their query, without waiting for other sources. Can significantly reduce waiting time

Maximum wait time for each query. At the end of this time, a data source will be automatically selected from those already queried based on your preferences. If the wait time is too short, your preference settings may be ignored; if longer, it can better meet your preferences but may cause slow playback starts. 5–10 seconds is recommended

During playback, display disabled data sources from the "Data Source Management" settings in gray, rather than hiding them. This allows temporarily enabling disabled sources when preferred sources don\'t have resources
Can filter out some raw resources, but may also filter out resources where subtitle type wasn\'t detected
Hide Single-Episode BT Resources After One Year
Single-episode resources typically have no speed after an anime has been completed for a year
Prioritize Season Collections for BT Resources
Season collection resources are usually faster, recommended to enable
Automatically Enable Last Temporarily Enabled Data Source
If a data source is disabled in the "Data Source Management" settings but used when watching an anime, automatically enable this source the next time this anime is played
Current setting: Auto-cache all unwatched episodes,
Current setting: Auto-cache %d episodes after current progress,
Long press to sort, higher-ranked items are prioritized.\nFewer selected items means faster queries.
